_comments.threads: Number of parallel worker threads for processing images. Set to 1 for single-threaded, or use number of CPU cores for maximum speed.
_comments.min_improvement_pct: Minimum percentage size reduction required to keep a converted file. If conversion doesn't save at least this much, original is kept. Range: 0-100.
_comments.hang_timeout: Seconds to wait without progress before reporting a potential hang. Used to detect stuck conversions.
_comments.recursive: If true, processes images in subdirectories. If false, only processes top-level folder.
_comments.skip_extensions: File extensions to skip (already optimized formats). Extensions should include the leading dot (e.g., '.webp').
_comments.jpegxl_quality: JPEG XL quality setting (1-100). 100 = mathematically lossless. Lower values reduce file size but may introduce loss.
_comments.jpegxl_effort: JPEG XL compression effort (0-9). Higher values = better compression but slower. 9 = maximum compression.
_comments.webp_method: WebP compression method (0-6). Higher values = better compression but slower. 6 = maximum compression.
_comments.conversion_timeout: Maximum seconds to wait for a single image conversion before timing out.
_comments.max_animated_frames: Maximum number of frames to process for animated GIFs. Prevents processing extremely large animations.
_comments.log_file: Path to the log file where processing details are written.
_comments.log_verbosity: Logging verbosity level: 'DEBUG' (most verbose), 'INFO' (default), 'WARNING', or 'ERROR' (least verbose).
_comments.enable_notifications: If true, sends system notifications for completion, errors, and hang detection (macOS/Windows/Linux).
